Recap: Ava and Coop go to their respective bedrooms at the boarding house and both blast themselves for not acting on their attraction for each other. Coop punches the wall and winds up punching a hole straight through to Ava's room. He comes over to apologize and she asks him to stay. They get into a playful fight with the spackling when Coop goes to fix it. Lizzie and Jonathan start kissing passionately and one thing leads to another and they have sex. Lizzie wants to use what happens so that both of them get what they want but Jonathan tells her to forget it ever happened. When Lizzie realizes that she left her bra in Jonathan's room, he goes to get it. Tammy shows up at the bar after a talk with Harley about not caring what other people think. After Lizzie quietly retrieves her bra without clueing Tammy in, Tammy tells Jonathan that she wants him back. Lizzie goes to the boarding house and letting herself into Coop's room sees him and Ava fooling around through the hole in the wall, she calls someone to have them check out everything on Ava. Alan and Alan-Michael go at it until Marina steps in and defends A-M. She corrects Alan when he calls her A-M's girlfriend though and later A-M tells Marina he will get the two things he wants, control over Spaulding and her. Alan goes to Towers where he runs into Gus and Dinah. Getting upset with Gus, Alan takes his cane and smacks Gus in the leg with it. Dinah sees Gus take one of his pills and after threatening Alan goes to talk to Harley. She tells her about the pain Gus is in and the pills and Harley asks Dinah to give her speech at the fundraiser Spaulding is throwing tonight. A-M later congratulates Dinah on getting what she wants from Harley, although Dinah swears not to know what he is talking about.
Transcript: Lizzie: Jeez, you could have at least waited for me.
Jonathan: Yeah, well, I didn't.
Lizzie: Pour me one, too.
Jonathan: Look, little girl, you've had more than enough to drink for one night. Hey!
Lizzie: You could have at least used the good stuff.
Jonathan: Do you think this is going to help you forget about Coop?
Lizzie: No. But at least I'll be drunk while I'm obsessing about him. It beats being sober. Why, are you telling me a couple more shots will make you forget about Tammy?
Jonathan: I don't know, but I'm going to find out. You know, it wouldn't be so bad if I knew that she was as miserable as I am, you know.
Lizzie: It's kind of twisted, but I actually get it.
Jonathan: Yeah, I'll bet you do. It just wouldn't hurt so much if I knew that it cost her something to kick me out.
Lizzie: Is that better?
Jonathan: I heard you say you think about me all of the time.
Tammy: I want to stop!
Jonathan: You can't stop. You can't stop yourself, and this piece of paper can't stop you. ( Heavy breathing )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Coop: Hey, whoa! Hi.
Ava: Hi. I didn't expect you up here so soon.
Coop: Sorry. I thought you were already in your room. I didn't mean to...
Ava: Yeah, well, I have an early shift in the morning. After today's drama, I don't know, I'm feeling kind of awake.
Coop: Yeah, right. Warm milk and a boring book. I know it sounds kind of cheesy, but it usually works.
Ava: For what?
Coop: For insomnia.
Ava: Oh! Right. Of course.
Coop: Yeah. Well, anyway, look, I'll see you tomorrow. Okay?
Ava: Bright and early.
Coop: Yes, yes. Good night. Oh, my goodness. Good night.

Alan: Maybe that's why you're girlfriend gave up on you, because she knows you're weak and will amount to nothing.

Alan-Michael: Let's get out of here.
Alan: No, no, no, no, no. It's starting to get interesting.

Marina: You know, everyone always talks about how much Alan Spaulding loves his family. Tell me this: Name me one child of yours that even likes you. Go ahead, name one. That's what I thought. Tell me this: Did you ever even really love Alan-Michael?
Alan: Of course I love Alan-Michael. I love all of my children.
Marina: See, that's funny, because the way I see it, the only thing you ever did was make Alan-Michael feel inferior.
Alan: I love this, your girlfriend sticking up for you.
Marina: Ex-girlfriend. What? I am.

Dinah: Thank you.
Gus: Hi, how's it going?
Dinah: Hi, how are you?
Gus: Good.
Dinah: You look good.
Gus: Thanks. So, Harley told me how you're throwing yourself into your work ever since what happened to your dad.
Dinah: Yes, yes. I think that's probably the best thing I should be doing right now.

Harley: "I'm Harley Cooper, CEO of Spaulding Enterprises, and on behalf of our entire workforce, I would like to welcome you all here tonight..."

Harley: I'm not really working. I'm practicing a speech. Come on in, this is the living room.
Tammy: It's coming along.
Harley: Yeah, it's coming along. It needs walls and floors, but we call it home.
Zack: Can I show R.J. where my room is going to be?
Harley: Sure, sure, be careful. You okay?
Tammy: Yeah, sure,
Harley: Really?
Tammy: No. It is just life getting more complicated. You probably know about it.
Harley: Yeah.
Tammy: I bet you can't wait for this place to be finished and then something will be simple.

Harley: Oh, gosh, it's our dream home. Our neighbors think we're crazy, but we're actually having a lot of fun. And you get to a point where you know it only matters what you think. It doesn't matter what anybody else thinks.
( Heavy breathing )
Jonathan: You know what this means.
Lizzie: Yes. We both don't need to have clothes on...
Jonathan: I'm just saying when it is done, it's over. We forget about it, okay?
Lizzie: Stop worrying and talk less.
Ava: "After all of the drama today, I'm feeling really awake." Ava, you're such a dork.

Coop: "Why don't you just grab some milk and a nice book." That's great, Henry, that's real eloquent, great stuff.

( Heavy breathing )
Lizzie: So that's what it's like.

Lizzie: No, but it is different without feelings... you know, without feelings for each other.
Jonathan: Yeah, sometimes things like that happen.
Lizzie: Yeah, I know. But we both want more.

Lizzie: Just like that?
Jonathan: Yeah, just like that. Oh! Look, you know we agreed we were going to forget about it, so...
Lizzie: Actually, you said that. I didn't. Will you just take a second to listen to what I'm saying? I love Coop too much to let him go.
Jonathan: Good for you. That solves our problem how?
Lizzie: My point is, I want Coop, but I know deep down somewhere he wants me, too. It is the same for you and Tammy.
Jonathan: So?
Lizzie: So why don't we work together to get them back. You're saying forget tonight. What I'm saying is we should use tonight. Face it, we still need each other.

Tammy: I like the homey touch.
Harley: Hmm? Oh, yes. I hung that up when Gus was missing. You know, holding onto hope, any kind of hope.
Tammy: Hope.
Harley: You and Jonathan?
Tammy: We're over.
Harley: Sorry, babe.
Tammy: It's not like you and Gus. Everybody likes seeing you two together. It makes me believe in true love. Me and Jonathan, not so much.
Harley: The cousin thing?
Tammy: That's part of it. We're not made for each other like you and Gus are.
Harley: Made for each other? You should ask our families about that.
Tammy: It doesn't hurt you to love Gus the way loving Jonathan hurts me.

Harley: Me and Gus hurt each other, plenty. We made a lot of mistakes. We've also gotten through a lot of stuff together. And I'm warning you, that's going to be tough, too, because you'll have to work out things with that person, also. I was going to stop construction on this place when Gus was missing, but then, I don't know, it became this thing for me to hang my hope on. Sort of a work in progress, I guess, like we are-- I mean, he and I are. We're never going to be perfect together, but we're not going to stop trying.
Tammy: You must have been so happy to get him back after figuring you would have to spend your life without him?
Harley: Well, I would never stop trying.

Harley: No, I would never stop trying. You know, you don't just give up on a love like that.

Alan-Michael: Oh!
Marina: What?

Gus: What do you want, Alan?
Alan: I want world peace, like everyone else, and a son who shows me a little respect.

Gus: Excuse me. This is an Alan Spaulding-free zone. Maybe you didn't know the Springfield Police Department is honoring my wife tonight, the boss, the CEO of what used to be your company. The sooner you can get that through your head, I think the better. There ain't nothing you can do about it.
Alan: We'll see about that.

Gus: No, the only thing that we'll see-- actually, that you'll see-- is that she is going to be the CEO of what used to be your company for a very, very, very long time. So if you get those delusional thoughts of ever getting your big chair back, grab them and leave.
Alan: That's very sad, Gus, because you and I have been through a lot. Especially in the last few months.
Gus: Yes, we have.
Alan: I thought we had come to some kind of understanding or respect.
Gus: Really? I guess we haven't.
Alan: No, no, I guess we haven't. That's a nice cane you have. No true Spaulding ever needed a crutch.

Gus: I'll play any game you want to play. Fight you any way you want to fight. With our fists, in the boardroom, in the newspaper, you name it.

Gus: No, I'm fine. I just need to just sit here for a second.

Dinah: If you are hurt, Harley will understand. You two need to stick together...

[NEXT_ON]

Reva: It is something. It is something. It is divorce papers, because tomorrow I get to sign away my marriage to Josh in triplicate. Why in the world would you go through with this? Sometimes it just happens.
Jonathan: What is this, some kind of test?
Tammy: I came back for you, Jonathan.
